newsitem.title: CANADA: TENNIS-LIKHOVTSEVA, PO ADVANCE TO SECOND ROUND IN QUEBEC.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-LIKHOVTSEVA, PO ADVANCE TO SECOND ROUND IN QUEBEC.

text.p: Second seed Elena Likhovtseva of Russia gave herself a needed confidence boost with a straight sets victory in the first round of the Bell Challenge tennis tournament on Tuesday.
Likhovtseva, a first-round loser in Leipzig and Filderstadt, dismissed 64th-ranked Australian Rennae Stubbs 6-3 7-5.
The second seed was joined in the second round by fourth-seeded American Kimberly Po, who breezed past compatriot Corina Morariu 6-2 6-0.
American Jolene Watanabe scored the upset of the day when she rallied from a set down to pick off seventh seed Nana Miyagi of Japan 4-6 6-1 6-4.
"I could have won more easily," said the 24th-ranked Likhovtseva, who ran off the last four games after falling behind 3-5 in the second set.

"But I lost in the first round of my last two tournaments so this was good for my confidence," admitted the 21-year-old Likhovtseva, who was originally from Kazakhstan but now lives in Moscow and plays Fed Cup for Russia.
Still, she is passing up a tournament in Moscow to play in Chicago next week.
Asked if that was because of a lack of support from the Russian tennis federation, she smiled and said, "partly."
Po, who has seen her ranking rise from 164 at the end of last year to her current career-high of 33rd in the world, said she thought she might have a tougher time with the 116th-ranked Morariu.
"The first few games were very even and she played really well," Po said.
"If she'd played like that the whole match I knew I'd have a hard time. So I tried not to give her any free points and I think she got discouraged."
